8.2 [[MyNetworkTV]]| other_chs = | affiliations = [[CBS]], [[MyNetworkTV]]| network = | founded = | airdate = August 8, 1954| location = [[La Crosse, Wisconsin|La Crosse]]/[[Eau Claire, Wisconsin]]| callsign_meaning = Derived from sister radio station WKBH, which was owned by a music store that sold [[Kimball International|Kimball Pianos]] (the store's slogan: '''''K'''''imball '''''B'''''rings '''''H'''''appiness)| former_callsigns = | former_channel_numbers = '''Analog''': 8 (VHF)
(8/8/1954 - 2/17/2009)
'''Digital''': 41 (UHF)
(3/28/2003 - 2/17/2009)| owner = [[Morgan Murphy Media]]| licensee = QueenB Television, LLC| sister_stations = [[WISC-TV]]
[[TVW (WISC-TV)|TVW]]| former_affiliations = '''All secondary''':
[[American Broadcasting Company|ABC]] (1954-1970)
[[DuMont Television Network|DuMont]] (1954-1955)
[[NBC]] (1954-1958)
[[UPN]] (2006)| effective_radiated_power = 20 [[kilowatt|kW]]| HAAT = 469 [[metre|m]]| class = | facility_id = 74424| coordinates = {{coord|44|5|27.4|N|91|20|17.4|W|type:landmark_scale:2000}}| homepage = [http://www.news8000.com/ www.news8000.com]| }} '''WKBT-DT''' is a [[television station]] owned and operated by [[Morgan Murphy Media]] and serving West Central [[Wisconsin]], including [[La Crosse, Wisconsin|La Crosse]] (its [[city of license]]) and [[Eau Claire, Wisconsin|Eau Claire]]. The station is primarily affiliated with [[CBS]] and airs programming from [[MyNetworkTV]] on its [[digital subchannel]]. ==History== [[File:WKBTStudios.jpg|thumb|right|Studios of WKBT-DT]]WKBT launched on August 8, 1954 as sister station to WKBH, a radio station known today as as [[WIZM (AM)|WIZM]]. (The "T," for "television," replaced the "H" in the [[call sign]] to differentiate the stations.) WKBT carried dual affiliation with [[CBS]] and [[American Broadcasting Company|ABC]], a set-up that continued until 1970, when WKBT became solely a CBS affiliate. WKBT also briefly had secondary affiliations with DuMont (until 1956) and NBC (until 1958).[http://radioinsight.com/boards/index.php?t=tree&th=8267&start=0&S=6c409f4aeab9555b176b62f83b344f58] On April 16th, 1965, during the worst of the famous 1965 flood, the downtown [[La Crosse, Wisconsin|La Crosse]] building that housed both WKBT and WKBH fell victim to fire; WKBT then rebuilt its current building on the same site. In the 1970s, WKBT was sold to Harold F. Gross, a businessman from [[Lansing, Michigan]] who owned [[WJIM (AM)|WJIM-AM]]-[[WJIM-FM|FM]]-TV in that city. WKBT and WJIM-TV were sold in the mid-1980s to Unicom Inc, a unit of [[Forstmann Little & Company|Forstmann Little]], d.b.a. Backe Communications, following a licensing dispute involving WJIM-TV (which changed its call letters to [[WLNS-TV]]). Unicom's ownership of the station was short-lived as in 1986 it sold WLNS and WKBT to [[Young Broadcasting]]. In March 2000, Young sold WKBT to Morgan Murphy Stations, whose QueenB Television subsidiary (now [[Morgan Murphy Media]]) became the licensee for the station. WKBT-DT went on the air with digital broadcasting on channel 41 (UHF) on March 28, 2003. http://www.avsforum.com/avs-vb/showthread.php?p=2253116#post2253116 WKBT-DT launched digital subchannel 8.2, ''UPN La Crosse/Eau Claire'', on Monday January 30, 2006.http://findarticles.com/p/articles/mi_qa3652/is_200603/ai_n17179469/ (Rival station [[KQEG-CA]] had dropped its affiliation with [[UPN]] at the end of the previous week.http://www.lacrossetribune.com/news/article_0b5326c6-5c9a-5f06-8f04-3f5914934aa3.html) Beginning September 5, 2006, with the demise of UPN, WKBT-DT2 subchannel 8.2 became an affiliate of the new [[MyNetworkTV]]. On the afternoon of Tuesday, February 17, 2009, WKBT-TV discontinued analog broadcasting on channel 8 (VHF), and the digital WKBT-DT signal was transitioned from channel 41 (UHF) to channel 8 (VHF), completing the station's digital broadcast transition. In the summer of 2011, WKBT became the first station in the La Crosse/Eau Claire [[DMA]] to air newscasts in high definition. ==News/station presentation== ===Newscast titles=== *''Total News'' (1971-1974) *''TV-8 [[Action News]]'' (1974-1976) *''Action 8 News'' (1976-1987) *''[[NewsWatch (branding)|Newswatch]] 8'' (1987-1994) *''Channel 8 News'' (1994-1995) *''NewsChannel 8'' (1995-October 24, 2010) *''News 8'' (October 25, 2010-present) ===Station slogans=== *''8 Country'' (1970s) *''Action 8 is Total News'' (1970s) *''Serving the Tri-State'' (1980s) *''Do you watch Newswatch?'' (1980s-1994) *''Take Me There, Make Me Care'' (1994-1998) *''Coverage You Can Count On'' (1998-2010) *''Our Community, Your Station'' (June 2009 in TV ads, 2010-present) ==MyNetworkTV La Crosse/Eau Claire== [[MyNetworkTV]] La Crosse/Eau Claire is slowly being developed. It carries syndicated shows such as ''[[The Simpsons]]'', ''[[Dr. Phil (TV series)|Dr. Phil]]'', and programming with local interest, such as ''Racing Rewind'' (a show about weekly races at the La Crosse Fairgrounds Speedway), and a few one-time airings of local events. There is a newscast called ''My News at Nine'' shown weekdays at 9 pm. In 2009 WKBT stopped making ''My NewsChannel 8 at Nine'' and reaires the 5 pm news. On the early snowy morning February 25, 2007, the channel aired a 2 hour 30 minute live newscast, to keep people informed of a snowfall that brought over 28 inches of snow to the area. ==On-air staff== ===Anchors=== *Lou Hillman - Saturday evening anchor and weekday reporter *Lisa Klein - 5 & 6 pm co-anchor *Martha Koloski - Noon & 10 pm co-anchor *Jennifer Livingston - "News 8 This Morning" *Mark McPherson - 5 pm co-anchor and Sunday evening anchor *Mike Thompson - 6 & 10 pm co-anchor ===Reporters=== *Jenna Troum *Pauleen Le ===Weather=== *Bill Graul - Meteorologist;"News 8 This Morning" and Noon *Cory Malles - Chief Meteorologist; 5pm. 6pm & 10 pm *Michelle Poedel- Weekend Meteorologist ===Sports=== *Ryan Rodig - Weekend Sports anchor *Gregg Wavrunek - Sports Director/Weeknight Sports ===Former on-air staff=== *[[David Bloom]] ==Transmitter== WKBT's transmitter is located in [[Galesville, Wisconsin]], about 30 miles north of the actual station in order to provide their signal to the entire market - it also serves as the CBS affiliate for the [[Chippewa Valley]]. If put up next to Chicago's [[Willis Tower]] (formerly known as the Sears Tower), the WKBT transmitter would surpass the upper roof and fall just about 100 feet short of the highest antenna on top. ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== *[http://www.news8000.com/ WKBT Website] *[http://www.wkbt.com/Global/category.asp?C=84690&nav=menu239_14 WKBT DT2 MNTV Website] *{{TVQ|WKBT}} *{{BIA|WKBT|TV|DT}} {{Eau Claire TV}} {{CBS Wisconsin}} {{MNTV Wisconsin}} {{Morgan Murphy}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Wkbt-Dt}} [[Category:CBS network affiliates]] [[Category:MyNetworkTV affiliates]] [[Category:Channel 8 digital TV stations in the United States]] [[Category:Television channels and stations established in 1954]] [[Category:Television stations in Wisconsin]]
